xstampp.model

Interface IDataModel


  • public interface IDataModel
    Interface for the DataModel which defines the methods to handle the Observer pattern. All other interfaces for the data model should extend this interface
    Author:
    Fabian Toth

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
      Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
      int countObservers()
      Returns the number of observers of this Observable object.
      void deleteObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
      Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object.
      org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job doSave(java.io.File file, org.apache.log4j.Logger log, boolean isUIcall) 
      java.lang.String getFileExtension() 
      java.lang.String getPluginID() 
      java.lang.String getProjectName() 
      boolean hasUnsavedChanges() 
      void initializeProject()
      This method is only to be called the first time the projekt is started to perform initial actions like "not visited" flags or so
      boolean prepareForExport()
      Prepares the data model for the export
      void prepareForSave()
      Removes the preparations that were made for the export
      boolean setProjectName(java.lang.String projectName) 
      void setStored()

      void updateValue(ObserverValue value)
      Triggers an update of the given value

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        void addObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
        Parameters:
        observer - an observer to be added.

      • deleteObserver

        void deleteObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object.
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to be deleted.

      • doSave

        org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job doSave(java.io.File file,
                                         org.apache.log4j.Logger log,
                                         boolean isUIcall)
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which the job should store the results
        log - the logger in which all messeges are written
        isUIcall - the Data model which should be stored, this must be a JAXBContext
        Returns:
        a Job that handles the saving of the project

      • countObservers

        int countObservers()
        Returns the number of observers of this Observable object.
        Returns:
        the number of observers of this object.

        Prepares the data model for the export
        Returns:
        whether successful or not

      • prepareForSave

        void prepareForSave()
        Removes the preparations that were made for the export

        Triggers an update of the given value
        Parameters:
        value - the given value to update

      • getProjectName

        java.lang.String getProjectName()
        Returns:
        returns the project Name must not be null

      • setStored

        void setStored()
        sets the state of the dataModel to saved

      • hasUnsavedChanges

        boolean hasUnsavedChanges()
        Returns:
        returns wether the currrent state of the dataModel is stored or unstored

      • setProjectName

        boolean setProjectName(java.lang.String projectName)
        Parameters:
        projectName - The name of the project
        Returns:
        if the name has succesfullly been changed

      • initializeProject

        void initializeProject()
        This method is only to be called the first time the projekt is started to perform initial actions like "not visited" flags or so

      • getFileExtension

        java.lang.String getFileExtension()
        Returns:
        the extension which is stored in the stepped process for this DataModel must not return null!

      • getPluginID

        java.lang.String getPluginID()
        Returns:
        the id for the Plugin which is used by the DataModel
